Class GameConfigurationDialog

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Dialog
javax.swing.JDialog
GameConfigurationDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class GameConfigurationDialog
extends javax.swing.JDialog
GameConfigurationDialog is a customized JDialog that uses JRadioButtons and JTextFields to let Players choose their character and type their nickname. It pops up at the start of the game.
Author:
johnh
See Also:

      private javax.swing.JPanel createConfirmPanel​(javax.swing.JPanel optionsPanel)
      Creates a JPanel with a JButton letting players confirm their choice. The button proceeds the dialog to the next set of options.
      Parameters:
      optionsPanel - the options panel with options to change when dialog is proceeded
      Returns:
      confirm panel

    • proceedDialog

      private void proceedDialog​(javax.swing.JPanel optionsPanel)
      When called, the optionsPanel is changed to hold a new set of JRadioButtons with the next set of options to choose from.
      Parameters:
      optionsPanel - the panel of options
